result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:43 AM Defendant Anthony F Rios in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Anthony F Rios.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense request jury trial and final pre-trial.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony F Rios in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Anthony F Rios. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. Victim's mother present in court 
Defense requests another status date as he is still obtaining digital discovery. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim C.G (person, property, residence or family). Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments as well as employment if verified by RCAP Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 04-27-22 DEFENDANT MAY HAVE A GPS EXCEPTION TO GO TO SCHOOL, MUST VERIFY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES.

AMENDED 7/25/2022 to remove GPS condition
